sn24.18:0.3: 18. A Realized One Neither Exists Nor Doesn’t Exist
sn24.18:1.2: “Mendicants, when what exists, because of grasping what and insisting on what, does the view arise:
sn24.18:1.3: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
sn24.18:1.4: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”
sn24.18:2.1: “When form exists, because of grasping form and insisting on form, the view arises:
sn24.18:2.2: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’ …
sn24.18:3.4: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would the view arise:
sn24.18:3.5: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
sn24.18:3.7: “That which is seen, heard, thought, known, sought, and explored by the mind: is that permanent or impermanent?”
sn24.18:3.9: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn24.18:3.11: “But by not grasping what’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, would the view arise:
sn24.18:3.12: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
sn24.18:4.1: “When a noble disciple has given up doubt in these six cases, and has given up doubt in suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation,
sn24.18:4.2: they’re called a noble disciple who is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
